newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Fujimori's ex warns against talks with Peru rebels.
newsitem.headline: Fujimori's ex warns against talks with Peru rebels.

text.p: Susana Higuchi, ex-wife of Peru's President Alberto Fujimori, warned him in an interview published on Tuesday not to negotiate with the Marxist guerrillas holding 74 hostages at the Japanese ambassador's residence.

"They are a bunch of criminals and killers involved in the drug trade and there is nothing to negotiate with them," the former first lady, who divorced Fujimori in 1995, told the Argentine newspaper La Nacion.

Higuchi, who shares the Peruvian president's Japanese ancestry, praised his handling of the 3-week-old siege at the Japanese residence in Lima but said she would have dealt with it in a more decisive and tough manner.

She sent Fujimori advice about how to handle the crisis via their four children -- and says she would have cut off electricity, food and water to the residence right after the siege began and kept them hungry and thirsty for two days.
"Then on the third day I would have sent water cans with long-lasting sedatives, the kind that put you to sleep for 12 hours. They would have all been out pretty soon," she said.

Urged to seek a peaceful outcome to the crisis which began when about 20 heavily armed Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) rebels stormed a cocktail party and took more than 500 guests hostage, Fujimori refuses to rule out force until all hostages are released and the guerrillas lay down their arms.

"I think he is doing fine. I presume he has a strategy and wants to capture them by wearing them out," said Higuchi, who does not believe the president will cede to MRTA demands for action on poverty and prison conditions.
"Knowing the president as I do, I don't think so. He's not the kind of guy who goes for dialogue. But neither is an armed attack a civilised way to start a dialogue," she said.
Higuchi, who has formed her own political party called 20th Century Harmony, confessed to feeling "indifference" for her ex-husband rather than hatred, and said they have not talked for a long time.
"It's been 2 1/2 years without dialogue ... So in way, I'm worse off than the MRTA," she joked.
